alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Monroe; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 10:34PM EDT until July 24 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Monroe County in east central Ohio... East central Muskingum County in east central Ohio... Northern Noble County in east central Ohio... * Until 1130 PM EDT. * At 1033 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near New Concord, or near Cambridge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Cambridge, New Concord, Byesville, Antrim, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, Old Washington, Summerfield, Sarahsville, Salesville, Norwich, Seneca Lake Park, Wolf Run State Park, and Salt Fork State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 167 and 194. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 30 and 51. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
